newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo denies Renault share sale.
newsitem.headline: Volvo denies Renault share sale.

text.p: Swedish automotive group AB Volvo on Tuesday denied market rumours that it had sold shares in French auto maker Renault.
"We have not sold any Renault shares," Volvo spokesman Per Lojdqvist told Reuters.
"What we have said before is still valid -- in the long term we plan to divest our Renault shares, just as we plan to divest our shares (in Swedish/U.S. drugs group) Pharmacia & Upjohn."
Lojdqvist added that Volvo had not yet decided when to sell the shares.
The planned divestments are in line with Volvo's strategy to focus on its core automotive operations.
Volvo holds 11 percent of Renault and four percent of P&U.
Market rumours said Volvo had sold Renault shares in a large block trade.
Volvo was trading three crowns lower at 211.5 crowns at 0955 GMT with the Stockholm general index weaker across the board, falling 0.69 percent.
